name: UHS - Unified Header Source
tagline: Keeps your code in one place! - No replication - Half the navigation No more time spent on managing headers and thinking about what goes where!
body:
### UHS - Unified Header Source
UHS (Unified Header Source), is an abstractions layer on top of C++ more complicated header and source files.
UHS provides C++ developers with one single coding interface; the UHS file.

UHS is a simple visual studio package that automatically generates CPP and H files for you while you're coding. 
Things that should go to the H files (declarations, macros, templates, enums) is put into the H files while things that should be in the CPP files (implementation and definitions) is put in the CPP files.

note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
